author: Paloma Franco
title: Escape milagroso: Sobreviven a colapso de t√∫nel en Los √Ångeles
text:
Un grupo de trabajadores de la construcci√≥n en Los √Ångeles protagoniz√≥ un escape calificado como ¬´milagroso¬ª tras el colapso de un t√∫nel en el que operaban. El incidente ocurri√≥ en el sitio de la masiva Extensi√≥n de la L√≠nea D del Metro, un proyecto de miles de millones de d√≥lares.
Un desastre potencial se convirti√≥ en una historia de supervivencia en Los √Ångeles, cuando varios trabajadores de la construcci√≥n lograron escapar ilesos del colapso de un t√∫nel. El dram√°tico incidente tuvo lugar en una de las obras de la Extensi√≥n de la L√≠nea D (P√∫rpura) del Metro, un megaproyecto de infraestructura que busca transformar el transporte en el oeste de la ciudad.
Seg√∫n los informes, los trabajadores ¬´lucharon sobre una pila de tierra para escapar¬ª del t√∫nel que se derrumbaba a su alrededor. Afortunadamente, todas las personas que se encontraban en el interior en ese momento fueron reportadas como seguras, sin que se informara de heridos graves.
Un recordatorio del riesgo humano en los megaproyectos El incidente sirve como un crudo recordatorio de los peligros que enfrentan a diario los trabajadores que construyen las monumentales obras de infraestructura que definen las ciudades modernas. La Extensi√≥n de la L√≠nea D es uno de los proyectos de transporte p√∫blico m√°s ambiciosos de Estados Unidos en la actualidad.
Se trata de una extensi√≥n de nueve millas que se est√° construyendo en tres secciones separadas y que conectar√° el centro de Los √Ångeles con Westwood. La inversi√≥n total del proyecto asciende a miles de millones de d√≥lares, con contratos espec√≠ficos como el del lugar del incidente valorado en $700 millones.
Las obras, que comenzaron en 2019, implican la excavaci√≥n de t√∫neles profundos bajo una de las √°reas m√°s densamente pobladas de la ciudad, utilizando enormes m√°quinas tuneladoras y gr√∫as que operan constantemente a lo largo de Wilshire Boulevard.
Contexto del proyecto de la L√≠nea D El proyecto est√° dise√±ado para completarse en fases, con la apertura de las nuevas estaciones prevista entre 2025 y 2027. Una vez finalizada, la extensi√≥n proporcionar√° un servicio de metro crucial para cientos de miles de personas, conectando √°reas de gran actividad como Beverly Hills y Century City.
El escape de los trabajadores, aunque afortunado, pone de relieve la complejidad y el riesgo inherente a este tipo de construcciones subterr√°neas. Mientras los angelinos esperan los beneficios de un sistema de transporte m√°s robusto, el colapso es una pausa para reconocer el esfuerzo y el peligro que asume la mano de obra, a menudo invisible, que lo hace posible. Las autoridades no han informado de inmediato sobre el estado del proyecto de construcci√≥n tras el derrumbe.

author: Awin P
title: UAE Armed Forces unification anniversary is rich in lessons and experiences: Dubai's First Dy Ruler Maktoum bin Mohammed
text: UAE Armed Forces unification anniversary is rich in lessons and experiences: Dubai's First Dy Ruler Maktoum bin Mohammed S heikh Maktoum bin Mohammed bin Rashid Al Maktoum, First Deputy Ruler of Dubai, Deputy Prime Minister and Minister of Finance, highlighted the significance of the UAE Armed Forces unification anniversary. He emphasised that this event is rich in lessons and experiences, serving as a reminder of the wisdom, dedication, and generosity of the UAE's founding fathers. These leaders made the decision to unite the UAE armed forces to equip the young nation with strength and resilience. In a speech on the occasion of the 48th anniversary of the unification of the armed forces, Sheikh Maktoum bin Mohammed emphasised the significance of the May 6, 1976 anniversary. He noted that this date holds additional importance as it signifies the commencement of the UAE armed forces' development journey. These forces have now attained a high level of skill, capability, and preparedness that align with the exemplary Emirati model. This model is structured to encompass all the necessary components of self-sufficiency to support growth, advancement, and resilience. The following is the text of his speech on this occasion: "It is my honour to share with our wise leadership and the dear sons and daughters of the UAE the celebration of the 48th anniversary of the unification of the UAE Armed Forces. This occasion, full of lessons and experiences, reminds us of the wisdom, dedication, and giving of our founding fathers, led by the late Sheikh Zayed bin Sultan Al Nahyan. They came together on the decision to unify our armed forces to empower our young country with the means of strength and resilience, and to pave the way for deepening the unity of our Emirati family and strengthening our comprehensive national identity. On May 6, 1976, the unification of our armed forces marked a pivotal moment. It not only completed a key pillar of the UAE's foundation, but also set in motion the development of a powerful military that embodies the spirit of our nation. These forces, renowned for their efficiency, capability, and readiness, are a cornerstone of our self-sustaining Emirati model, ensuring continued progress and strength. The rapid localisation of all ranks stands as a testament to the success of this initiative. Furthermore, the armed forces have played a pioneering role in diversifying the economy by establishing a strong presence in the defense industry, paving the way for private sector involvement in this critical field. Our armed forces have represented the UAE in participation with international forces for peacekeeping, counterterrorism, and assisting those affected by conflicts and natural disasters. Our leaders have supported the armed forces in their development and progress. Special thanks to President and Supreme Commander of the Armed Forces, Sheikh Mohamed bin Zayed Al Nahyan, for his leadership in enhancing our armed forces and defence industry. We honour the officers and soldiers for their loyalty, dedication, and bravery in both peace and wartime. We also acknowledge their colleagues who have made sacrifices, along with their families. On this important occasion, we reaffirm our commitment to our leaders by demonstrating loyalty and dedication to safeguard our nation's interests and uphold their achievements while striving for new successes." (ANI/WAM) ‚úîÔ∏è UAE Armed Forces unification anniversary is rich in lessons and experiences: Dubai's First Dy Ruler Maktoum bin Mohammed üíï Found this article helpful? Spread the word and support us!

author: Merry
title: Millions of obese patients taking Ozempic are at risk of gaining MORE weight ‚Äì because they don‚Äôt take the drug for long enough, experts warn
text:
Few words were more on people‚Äôs lips in 2023 than Ozempic, Wegovy and Mounjaro.
Successful weight loss medications, which work by suppressing hunger hormones, are very effective.
But now, experts warn that many of the nine million prescriptions given for these drugs could be, at best, useless and, at worst, putting patients at even greater risk of suffering from drug-related illnesses. weight.
This is because many are given courses of the medication that are too short.
According to recent warnings, employers are offering insurance plans that only cover use of the drug for a short period, such as a year, to save money.
However, a growing body of evidence shows that patients who stop taking weekly injectable medications quickly regain the pounds they lost.
About 9 million Ozempic prescriptions were issued in early 2022 alone.
What‚Äôs more, abruptly stopping medications puts patients at greater risk for weight-related health problems, such as high blood pressure, high blood glucose levels, and changes in cholesterol.
The effects of abruptly stopping weight-loss medications are similar to those of harmful yo-yo dieting, which causes a cycle of weight loss and regain that contributes to the risk of type 2 diabetes, heart attacks, and eating disorders.
Brooke Boyarsky Pratt, a prescriber and CEO of the Knownwell weight loss clinic in New York, says she has seen many patients who were told they would stop taking the medication after 12 months.
‚ÄúI think it will be a compelling narrative given the number of patients who qualify for these drugs and their high cost,‚Äù he told Fierce Healthcare.
‚ÄúThe difficulty is that there is no data to support that (weight loss after one year) and, in fact, the data very clearly suggests the opposite.‚Äù
The problem lies with healthcare companies that employers are increasingly using to get good insurance for their employees.
One of the most popular companies that does this is Calibrate, which primarily prescribes medications directly to patients.
It also works with insurance companies to get patients the drug for about $25 a month.
More recently, it has begun helping employers negotiate better, lower-cost insurance deals for workers.
As part of this, Calibrate is launching plans that provide a limited course of medications before tapering them off to patients, a way to reduce costs for the employer.
A UK study found that people who used Wegovy experienced rapid weight loss, losing 18% of their weight in 68 weeks. They regained two-thirds of that weight, or 12% of their original body weight, in the year after stopping the weekly injections. Experts say the drug should be used throughout life to avoid weight loss
The most recent anti-obesity drug to hit the market was Eli Lilly‚Äôs Zebpound, a rebranding of the pharmaceutical giant‚Äôs existing type 2 diabetes drug, Mounjaro.
Both medications contain the active ingredient tirzepatide, which suppresses two hormones that regulate appetite, making people feel fuller for longer.
Other blockbusters include Wegovy and Ozempic, the same drugs but in different doses containing semaglutide, which stimulates weight loss by mimicking the actions of GLP-1, or glucagon-like peptide-1, a hormone in the brain that regulates appetite and feeling of satiety. .
While extremely effective at helping patients lose an average of 15 to 20 percent of their body weight, the medications cost a little more than $1,300 per package, which breaks down to nearly $270 per week or about $16,190 per anus. Insurance doesn‚Äôt always pay the bill.
Calibrate specializes in working directly with consumers who pay a one-time fee of approximately $1,700 to gain access to personalized health counseling and, if eligible, a prescription for a weight loss medication for an additional cost per dose.
The company then negotiates with insurers to have patients shell out a monthly cost of $25 or less. But the company has struggled to give patients timely access to drugs amid shortages and insurers reducing coverage.
Now, Calibrate is working with employers who provide health insurance to workers and with the insurance companies themselves.
The goal is to have the Calibrate program, including the medications your doctors prescribe, covered by insurance plans that employers purchase for their employees.
Companies like Ro and Calibrate describe their weight loss programs that include medications as the most effective approach to achieving sustainable weight loss. But they fail to make it clear that most people need to continue taking medications to maintain weight.
Brooke Boyarsky Pratt, founder and CEO of weight loss clinic Knowwell, said
Fierce healthcare: ‚ÄòI think we‚Äôre going to see more and more LPG-1 companies that were previously business-to-consumer now selling into the employer space, claiming they have the silver bullet for spending LPG-1.
‚ÄúWe‚Äôre hearing from employers everywhere that this is what they‚Äôre being told.‚Äù
Calibrate said it has designed a program to help patients taking the drugs reduce their dosage and eventually stop taking them altogether, a benefit to insurers who would not need to cover the expensive medications indefinitely.
A Calibrate spokesperson said: ‚ÄúWhile the current clinical paradigm for GLP-1 treatment requires lifelong medication at the highest dose, Calibrate is exploring whether members can stop taking the medication while maintaining their results.‚Äù
‚ÄúAs a result, Calibrate is the first and only program with a proactive plan to get members off medications.‚Äù
Calibrate conducted its own analysis to see if its members could maintain weight, reporting that 93 percent suffered more than 10 percent weight loss six to 12 months after starting to taper off GLP-1 medications.
Influencer Remi Bader said she ‚Äúgained back twice as much weight‚Äù after stopping taking Ozempic, which she had been prescribed to help her deal with binge eating.
The latest data showing the rebound between weight loss and gain comes from a study conducted in
JAMA, which revealed that tirzepatide, which works like Ozempic, helped patients lose about 20 percent of their body weight after 36 weeks. But when they switched to a placebo, they regained 14 percent of the weight they lost over the next 52 weeks.
The authors said: ‚ÄúAt least five trials (including the present study) with various classes of drugs, including powerful anti-obesity drugs such as semaglutide, have shown substantial weight regain after smoking cessation.‚Äù
Studies on the effects of stopping Wegovy and Ozempic have provided similar results. A 2022 study in the journal
Diabetes, Obesity and Metabolism reported that patients taking semaglutide for 68 weeks lost an average of 17.3 percent of their body weight.
When they stopped treatment, they regained 11.6 percent of the weight lost at week 120, resulting in a net weight loss of just under six percent of body weight.
said Dr. Ania Jastreboff, an obesity medicine expert at Yale University.
People: If you have a patient who has high blood pressure, has hypertension, and you start them on an antihypertensive medication and their blood pressure improves, what would happen if you stopped that medication?
Medications like Ozempic and Wegovy are not a panacea for obesity, which experts say is a chronic disease that requires ongoing medication treatment as well as healthy lifestyle habits that include exercise and a healthy diet.
‚ÄòWell, his blood pressure would go up again, and we‚Äôre not surprised. The same goes for anti-obesity medications.‚Äô
Doctors say this is because the medications do not treat all the underlying causes of obesity, including poor lifestyle habits and a warped psychological relationship with food.
Dr Elie Jarrouge, a Houston-based metabolic disease expert, said: ‚ÄòFor people taking Ozempic or Wegovy to lose weight‚Ä¶ What is your exit strategy?
‚ÄúIf you don‚Äôt work to change what you eat, not just how much you eat and your relationship with food, you‚Äôre likely to gain the weight back.‚Äù
Influencer Remi Bader attested to this, having regained ‚Äúdouble the weight‚Äù she had lost while taking Ozempic.
Bader had sought treatment for binge eating disorder, which she said got much worse when she stopped taking the medication.
She said: ‚ÄúI saw a doctor and they said: it‚Äôs 100% because I took Ozempic.‚Äù
‚ÄòIt made me think I wasn‚Äôt hungry for so long that I lost some weight. I didn‚Äôt want to obsess over being in this for the long haul. I thought: I bet as soon as I get out I‚Äôll starve again. I did and my binge eating got much worse. ‚ÄúSo I blamed Ozempic.‚Äù

author: Team Open Sesame
title: DIY crafts to start 2024
text:
Want to kick off 2024 by being more organised and keeping your resolutions in check? Here are some DIY crafts that can help you achieve your goals ‚Äî be it saving money to buy a new cricket bat or scoring A+ in every subject.
Savings jar
Materials needed
Mason jar
Acrylic paint
Paintbrushes
Pencil
Scissors
Piece of cardboard
Glue
Method
To start, thoroughly clean and dry your mason jar. Up will only be needing the jar for this craft, not the lid.
Paint the jar white and let it air dry.
Once dry, you can start painting your desired designs. Be it a rainbow, cartoon characters or just some squiggly. Use as many colours as you like and let your creativity flow.
Next, trace a circle on the cardboard with your pencil and get an adult to help you cut it. The circle has to be the same size as the mouth of the mason jar.
Cut a slit in the middle of the circle ‚Äî big enough for coins and notes to fit in.
Paint the circle the colour of your choice and let it dry completely.
Firmly stick the circle to the top of the mason jar with glue and your savings jar is ready!
Mini scrapbook
Materials needed
Unruled A4 book
Chart paper (in multiple colours)
Scissors
Stapler
Glue
Various photos and memorabilia
Method
On the first page, you can name your scrapbook how you like. Something along the line of ‚ÄòMy Memories‚Äô.
Next, you can start by dividing your A4 book into 12 equal parts, one for each month. Make sure each month has at least 3-4 pages.
At the start of each month, you can write the name of the month in bold colours and start decorating the page. You can stick photos, movie tickets or any other memorabilia. You can also mention how your resolutions are faring.
In addition to memorabilia, cut two squares of chart paper ‚Äî In one square, you can write things that you are grateful for, and in the other can write your favourite moment from that month. You can stick the chart paper in the book, and decorate as you wish.
ADVERTISEMENT (Published 05 January 2024, 21:05 IST)

author: Serah S. Cherrie
title: Swelling, Blisters, And More ‚Äî IU Reveals Her Agonizing Health Condition - Koreaboo
text:
Singer IU recently opened up about having a rare syndrome that has been causing her much pain since she was younger.
IU | @dlwlrma/Instagram On December 19, IU appeared as a guest on actress Yoo In Na ‚Äôs YouTube channel and discussed a health condition she has been suffering from.
IU and Yo In Na | @Ïú†Ïù∏ÎùºÎîîÏò§/YouTube IU explained that she has something ‚Äú like a mosquito allergy,‚Äù which causes her skin to react harshly to a mosquito bite, forming lumps on her skin ‚Äú like an old man with a bump.‚Äù
The lumps then get infected and painful, leaving her with no choice but to take antibiotics.
Yoon In Na mentioned that a quick search revealed what IU had was called Skeeter‚Äôs Syndrome. The singer confirmed, adding, ‚Äú The area where I‚Äôm bitten swells up severely like an edema and blisters form.‚Äù
IU also expressed her frustration, mentioning that mosquitos often bite her face, leaving long-lasting scars. She revealed that she still has calloused skin on the area where she was bitten as a child. The singer finally declared that she hated mosquitos even more than cockroaches for this reason.
Meanwhile, IU has been caught up in political strife recently, creating heated public discourse. Read more about it here .

author: Lauren Weiler
title: 'Jersey Shore': Ronnie Ortiz-Magro Moved Into a $1.2 Million Miami Home Ahead of 'Family Vacation' Season 7
text: ‚ÄòJersey Shore‚Äô: Ronnie Ortiz-Magro Moved Into a $1.2 Million Miami Home Ahead of ‚ÄòFamily Vacation‚Äô Season 7 MTV‚Äôs [Jersey Shore: Family Vacation](https://www.cheatsheet.com/tag/jersey-shore-family-vacation/) Season 7 will be here before fans know it, and we can‚Äôt wait to see [Ronnie Ortiz-Magro back in the spotlight](https://www.cheatsheet.com/entertainment/jersey-shore-ronnie-ortiz-magro-is-back-but-is-the-cast-convinced-hes-changed-fans-say-no.html/) with the rest of the cast. Ronnie‚Äôs made headlines for several negative reasons. But it seems he got a fresh start in Miami with a $1.2 million home. Here‚Äôs what to know about his living situation ahead of the new season. ‚ÄòJersey Shore: Family Vacation‚Äô star Ronnie Ortiz-Magro recently moved into a Miami mansion Jersey Shore: Family Vacation Season 7 teasers revealed Ronnie Ortiz-Magro and Sammi Giancola will reunite under the same roof. Fans know them well for their on-again, off-again relationship that spanned all six seasons of Jersey Shore. They both went on to have lives outside of reality TV. As for Ronnie, [he made a big move in 2023](https://www.cheatsheet.com/entertainment/ronnie-ortiz-magro-returns-jersey-shore-family-vacation-update-daughter-move-miami-sneaker-business.html/). He bought a $1.2 million mansion in Miami. [The Sun](https://www.the-sun.com/entertainment/9684436/jersey-shore-ronnie-ortiz-magro-miami-mansion-pool/) revealed the home contains five bedrooms and three bathrooms over 2,500 square feet. It contains new features, such as LED lighting, a camera system, and water softeners and purifiers. The house boasts an inground pool with a cascade and a three-car garage with its own air conditioning unit. Of course, Ronnie also has a tanning area. Before Ronnie committed to living in Miami, he lived in Los Angeles. The Jersey Shore star purchased a home in LA for $1.9 million in 2020, and he sold it for $2.6 million in February 2023. It appears Ronnie was willing to downsize, too, as his LA home spanned 5,800 square feet with five beds, six baths, and a large gym. As for what Ronnie‚Äôs doing in Miami, he teased that he wanted to open a sneaker store called Sneaker Clinic in a past episode of Jersey Shore: Family Vacation. ‚ÄúI felt like I needed a change of scenery and a change of just pace in my life, so I decided to move from LA to Miami,‚Äù the star said. He sued his ex-girlfriend, Jenn Harley, over their Las Vegas home in 2021 Fans will find out Ronnie Ortiz-Magro‚Äôs relationship status in Jersey Shore: Family Vacation Season 7. In the past, [he dated Jenn Harley](https://www.cheatsheet.com/entertainment/ronnie-ortiz-magro-jenn-harley-now-reportedly-moving-miami-not-together.html/), and they now share a daughter. And in 2021, he had to deal with the Las Vegas home he shared with Jenn when they dated. [TMZ](https://www.tmz.com/2021/11/04/ronnie-ortiz-magro-sues-jenn-harley-las-vegas-home-force-sale-jersey-shore/) reported Ronnie tried to force Jenn to sell their home so he could move forward with some extra cash. According to the report, Ronnie claimed Jenn borrowed bank money to buy the home during their relationship. However, he said she stopped making payments on the house loan after he moved out. Ronnie also claimed there were liens on the home due to unpaid home improvements that he didn‚Äôt know Jenn had done. Ronnie wanted to sell the home and move forward, but Jenn allegedly refused. All in all, Ronnie hoped he could get a judge to force Jenn to sell the home so he could collect his payment. We imagine Ronnie‚Äôs happy to have this case behind him. Why did Ronnie Ortiz-Magro leave ‚ÄòJersey Shore: Family Vacation‚Äô? Jersey Shore: Family Vacation Season 7 features Ronnie Ortiz-Magro despite his choice to leave the series in the past. So, why did he leave before? [Ronnie announced his exit](https://www.cheatsheet.com/entertainment/ronnie-ortiz-magro-now-not-jersey-shore-family-vacation.html/) from the show days after getting arrested for domestic violence in 2021. ‚ÄúAfter talking to the team at MTV, we have mutually agreed that I will step away from the show while I seek medical treatment for mental health issues that I‚Äôve ignored for too long,‚Äù he wrote via Instagram Stories on May 13, 2021, according to [Yahoo](https://www.yahoo.com/entertainment/why-did-ronnie-ortiz-magro-185013101.html). ‚ÄúMy No. 1 goal now is facing my struggles head-on. This process will be difficult, but my No. 1 priority is to get healthy and be the best man and the best father I can [be] for my daughter.‚Äù How to get help: In the U.S., call the National Domestic Violence Hotline at 1-800-799-7233 or text START to 88788. Jersey Shore: Family Vacation Season 7 premieres on Feb. 8, 2024, at 8 p.m. ET on MTV. For more on the entertainment world and exclusive interviews, subscribe to [Showbiz Cheat Sheet‚Äôs YouTube channel](https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCWmTM34h0-P7FcCwuA6h6sw/videos).

author: Carolina Garc√≠a
title: Recibir esta vacuna redujo el riesgo de demencia en los adultos mayores en un 20%
text:
Recibir esta vacuna redujo el riesgo de demencia en los adultos mayores en un 20%
Un estudio de la Universidad de Stanford sugiere que la vacuna contra el herpes z√≥ster podr√≠a reducir el riesgo de demencia en un 20%.
CIUDAD DE M√âXICO.- Un estudio reciente de la Universidad de Stanford ha encontrado evidencia que sugiere que una vacuna ya existente podr√≠a ayudar a prevenir la demencia. Se trata de la vacuna contra el herpes z√≥ster, una enfermedad que provoca dolorosas erupciones en la piel. La investigaci√≥n analiz√≥ los registros de salud de m√°s de 280,000 adultos mayores en Gales y revel√≥ que aquellos que recibieron esta vacuna ten√≠an un 20% menos de probabilidades de desarrollar demencia en los siguientes siete a√±os.
Hallazgos sobre la vacuna contra el herpes z√≥ster
El doctor Pascal Geldsetzer, profesor asistente de medicina en Stanford, destac√≥ la importancia del hallazgo. ‚ÄúFue un resultado realmente sorprendente‚Äù, afirm√≥. Adem√°s, enfatiz√≥ que la relaci√≥n entre la vacuna y la reducci√≥n del riesgo de demencia se mantuvo constante bajo distintos m√©todos de an√°lisis de datos.
Aunque a√∫n no se conoce con certeza el mecanismo detr√°s de esta relaci√≥n, los cient√≠ficos creen que la vacuna podr√≠a reducir la inflamaci√≥n neuronal, un factor asociado al desarrollo de enfermedades neurodegenerativas como la demencia.
Un estudio con un enfoque innovador
Lo que hace a este estudio particularmente valioso es su dise√±o. En Gales, una pol√≠tica de salud p√∫blica permiti√≥ que solo las personas que cumplieron 80 a√±os despu√©s del 1 de septiembre de 2013 recibieran la vacuna. Aquellos que hab√≠an cumplido 80 a√±os justo antes de esa fecha no eran elegibles. Esto permiti√≥ comparar dos grupos de personas con caracter√≠sticas similares y determinar el impacto de la vacuna con mayor precisi√≥n.
‚ÄúSi tomas mil personas nacidas en una semana y mil nacidas una semana despu√©s, en promedio no deber√≠a haber diferencias significativas entre ellos, salvo la elegibilidad para la vacuna‚Äù, explic√≥ Geldsetzer. ‚ÄúEste tipo de dise√±o es casi como un ensayo cl√≠nico aleatorizado, lo que le da una fortaleza excepcional a los resultados‚Äù.
El estudio tambi√©n confirm√≥ un patr√≥n observado en investigaciones previas: el efecto protector de la vacuna es m√°s pronunciado en mujeres que en hombres. Esto podr√≠a deberse a que las mujeres tienen mayor riesgo de padecer herpes z√≥ster.
Otras vacunas y su relaci√≥n con la demencia
El estudio de Stanford no es el √∫nico que sugiere una conexi√≥n entre las vacunas y un menor riesgo de demencia. Investigaciones previas han encontrado que la vacuna recombinante contra el herpes z√≥ster, Shingrix, tambi√©n est√° asociada con una reducci√≥n del 17% en el riesgo de demencia en comparaci√≥n con su predecesora, Zostavax.
Por otro lado, un estudio de UTHealth Houston en 2023 descubri√≥ que las vacunas contra el t√©tanos y la difteria podr√≠an estar vinculadas a un menor riesgo de padecer Alzheimer. Adem√°s, otra investigaci√≥n publicada en 2022 encontr√≥ que las personas que recibieron al menos una vacuna contra la gripe ten√≠an un 40% menos de probabilidades de desarrollar esta enfermedad neurodegenerativa.
Tambi√©n podr√≠a interesarte: M√©xico refuerza vacunaci√≥n contra sarampi√≥n y tos ferina ante el aumento de casos
Los cient√≠ficos consideran que estas vacunas podr√≠an estar fortaleciendo el sistema inmunol√≥gico de una manera que reduce el riesgo de disfunci√≥n cerebral. Ahora, el equipo de Stanford busca realizar un ensayo cl√≠nico a gran escala para confirmar estos hallazgos y evaluar el impacto a largo plazo de la vacuna contra el herpes z√≥ster en la prevenci√≥n de la demencia.

author: Mara Pedrazzoli
title: Fuerte reclamo de las pymes en su d√≠a | Distintas entidades advirtieron por la crisis | P√°gina|12
text:
En 27 de junio la Asamblea General de las Naciones Unidas (ONU) conmemora el d√≠a internacional de las pymes para concienciar sobre la enorme contribuci√≥n de estas empresas al desarrollo social y econ√≥mico. En su d√≠a, las c√°maras empresarias pymes del pa√≠s se sumaron al homenaje pero lamentaron que en Argentina, bajo el actual Gobierno del presidente Milei se decidi√≥ ‚Äúignorar a nuestro sector, que vuelve a encontrarse en peligro de extinci√≥n‚Äù. Hoy es un d√≠a de reclamo, en lugar de festejo.
Lejos de avizorar alg√∫n horizonte de recuperaci√≥n, el conjunto de las pymes y buena parte del entramado industrial nacional se ven crecientemente amenazados ‚Äúpor la pol√≠tica del presidente Milei, LLA y sus aliados pol√≠ticos y corporativos. Por el ajuste sobre los sectores medios y m√°s vulnerables, el consiguiente deterioro del mercado interno, la brutal ca√≠da de la actividad y las desregulaciones que imparte la pol√≠tica p√∫blica‚Äù, advirtieron desde la Asamblea de Peque√±os y Medianos Empresarios (Apyme) en un comunicado difundido el jueves que lleva la firma de su presidente, Carlos A. Ferrari.
En paralelo notaron: ‚ÄúMientras realizamos estas reflexiones, en la C√°mara de Diputados se realiza el debate tras el cual se sancionar√°n la llamada Ley Bases y el Paquete Fiscal. Ning√∫n punto de estas normativas, en cualquiera de sus versiones, contiene a las pymes, sino que termina por marginarlas en favor de un esquema de mayor concentraci√≥n, extranjerizaci√≥n y extractivismo, sin contrapartida en aportes al valor local‚Äù. Desde Apyme hablan de evitar ‚Äúotro pymicidio‚Äù y llaman a todo el empresariado nacional a unirse junto con trabajadores, cooperativas, jubilados, universidades y la ciencia para buscar alternativas nacionales que tambi√©n resguarden a las instituciones democr√°ticas.
En tanto desde Industriales Pymes Argentinos (IPA), afirmaron que ‚Äúel sector se encuentra en una situaci√≥n de crisis por la falta de lealtad comercial en las importaciones‚Äù y acusaron al secretario de Comercio, Pablo Lavigne, de cerrar las puertas a un di√°logo que permita evitar la quiebra de cientos de pymes y miles de puestos de trabajo.
‚ÄúHoy es un d√≠a de reclamo, en lugar de festejo. Hace tiempo que venimos pidiendo una reuni√≥n con Lavigne, quien evit√≥ la reuni√≥n aduciendo problemas de agenda. Nuestro objetivo no es social, sino que busca plantear los perjuicios que genera a las f√°bricas nacionales, a toda la cadena de valor, pero tambi√©n a la sociedad entera por las pol√≠ticas de descontrol para el ingreso de importaciones, que nada tiene que ver con desregular el mercado. La falta de control de las importaciones dej√≥ en crisis a las pymes, puso en riesgo a los trabajadores y desamparada a la poblaci√≥n‚Äù, alert√≥ Daniel Rosato, presidente de IPA.
El presidente de IPA lament√≥ que el secretario de Comercio ‚Äúno tenga, ni siquiera, 10 minutos para atender las preocupaciones y las propuestas de las pymes‚Äù y contrapuso la predisposici√≥n que tuvo el jefe de Gabinete de Ministros, Guillermo Francos, al sostener: ‚Äúno s√≥lo recibi√≥ de antemano nuestra postura, sino que nos dedic√≥ una hora de audiencia, entendi√≥ nuestra postura y dej√≥ abierta una negociaci√≥n para avanzar en los puntos en com√∫n‚Äù. Sin embargo el intercambio no se tradujo a√∫n en pol√≠ticas expl√≠citas para el sector.
En su d√≠a, la ONU recuerda que ‚Äúlas microempresas y las peque√±as y medianas empresas representan el 90 por ciento de las empresas, entre el 60 y el 70 por ciento del empleo y el 50 por ciento del PIB mundial. Como columna vertebral de las sociedades de todo el mundo, contribuyen a las econom√≠as locales y nacionales y a mantener los medios de subsistencia, en particular entre los trabajadores m√°s pobres, las mujeres, los j√≥venes y otros grupos en situaci√≥n de vulnerabilidad‚Äù.

author: time news
title: ‚ÄúVitamin D helps reduce the risk of respiratory infections and some types of cancer‚Äù
text:
Vitamin D is one of the most important‚Å§ micronutrients for our health . Maintaining adequate ‚Å¢levels of this substance is essential for bone, cardiovascular and ‚Å§neurological health.‚Äå Because its‚Å¢ function is mainly ‚Äåto maintain‚Äç healthy bones, muscles‚Äç and nerves, support the immune system and help the body use a greater ‚Äãamount of calcium present ‚Å¢in foods.
Vitamin D is fat-soluble, meaning it dissolves in fats and oils, being stored ‚Å£in ‚Äåadipose tissues and the liver. It is synthesized in the skin thanks to ‚Å§the action of solar rays and can be ‚Å§obtained through food or‚Å§ supplements. It is an important vitamin: its deficiency‚Å¢ can cause various complications.
The past November 2nd was World Vitamin D Day . ‚Å£We talked about its needs ‚Äåand functions with‚Äå Dr. Bego√±a ‚Å£Ortiz Santodomingo, director of the Scientific Area of ‚Äã‚ÄãFarmasierra.
Vitamin ‚ÄçD requires diet, yes, like others, but it‚Äôs unique because it also requires the sun to‚Å£ activate, right?
First we need to clarify‚Å¢ that,‚Äå despite its name, vitamin D is actually a hormone. The‚Äå human body can produce vitamin D when we are‚Äå exposed to the sun. This process is very important because, although it is true that we can also‚Äã obtain vitamin D through‚Äå diet, with this own synthesis ‚Äçwe cover‚Å§ approximately 80% of our ‚Å£vitamin D ‚Å¢needs.
But that much?‚Äç Does sun exposure really cover 80% ‚Å£of your vitamin D ‚Äåneeds?
Yes, sun exposure is the very effective method to synthesize vitamin‚Å§ D. Additionally, humans produce a form of‚Å§ vitamin D (cholecalciferol or vitamin D3) which ‚Å§is ‚Å£the‚Å¢ most bioavailable form for‚Äã our‚Å§ body.
Yet we Spaniards fail in terms‚Äç of vitamin‚Äç D. ‚ÄåThe ANIBES study showed‚Å¢ that 94% of the population‚Å¢ aged between‚Å£ 10 and 75 consume less than 80% of the recommended‚Å§ dose The epidemiological‚Äå data on vitamin D ‚Äådeficiency in Spain is ‚Äãsurprising, especially considering that we live in a sunny‚Äã country. In the Nordic countries, the‚Å¢ population knows‚Å¢ the ‚Å¢importance of vitamin D, but they ‚Äãalso know that they cannot rely on the sun as a source of ‚Å¢vitamin D. Therefore, ‚Äçit supplements the ‚Äãpopulation ‚Äãwith vitamin D, either‚Äå through the ‚Å§diet with enriched foods or‚Äã through food supplements , thus ensuring vitamin D levels.
But does our ‚Äçlifestyle help with‚Å£ this?
In Spain we‚Å§ rely on obtaining vitamin D through the sun‚Äå and do not insist on diet. But the‚Äã reality‚Å§ is that our lifestyle, characterized by a sedentary lifestyle ‚Äçand long periods of time‚Å¢ indoors ‚Äå(work, car,‚Äã institutionalized elderly‚Ä¶ etc.), ‚Äålimits our ‚Å¢exposure ‚Äåto sunlight: and this is why ‚Äåhypovitaminosis‚Äã D data are worse than those observed‚Å§ in ‚Å§other ‚Å¢countries. ‚Å§
Who is at greater risk of‚Å§ suffering from vitamin D‚Å¢ deficiency?
People who expose themselves little to the sun are at greater risk of vitamin D deficiency. ‚Å¢These are‚Å£ people who spend ‚Äça lot of time indoors, ‚Å¢those who have a sedentary lifestyle, night‚Å§ workers, etc. The elderly are also a population at risk, as ‚Äåwith age the‚Å£ skin becomes‚Äã less efficient in ‚Å£the production of vitamin D.‚Äå Furthermore, ‚Å¢those who live ‚Å£in ‚Å£residences or long-term care ‚Å§centers usually have limited mobility and, therefore, less exposure ‚Äãto the sun and greater risk of deficit.
And obese people‚Ä¶
Yes, they are risky too; even ‚Äãthose with adequate sun exposure, as vitamin D ‚Äãis fatty‚Å§ in nature and can ‚Äçbecome ‚Äútrapped‚Äù in‚Å£ fat‚Äã cells, ‚Å§decreasing available vitamin ‚ÄçD ‚Å§levels. Patients with chronic‚Äç diseases or those being treated with certain drugs (corticosteroids and anticonvulsants) ‚Å§that can interfere with the production or ‚Å§use of vitamin‚Äã D in the body are also at risk.
Do growing children‚Äå need more vitamin D? For children over one year of age, doses of ‚Äã600 IU per day of vitamin D are recommended. These needs can be met through moderate sun exposure ‚Äå(playing outdoors)‚Å£ and‚Å£ a balanced diet that includes‚Å£ foods rich in vitamin D , like fatty‚Å§ fish.‚Å£ .,‚Å£ enriched eggs and ‚Äådairy products. But it is not ‚Äçrecommended to give vitamin D to children‚Å¢ without‚Äã doctor‚Äôs advice. ‚ÄãIt will always be the‚Å£ pediatrician who deems it‚Äã necessary or not to supplement a child with vitamin D.
And then also the children,‚Äã right?
Children under 1 year old deserve special mention. ‚ÄãThis is a population‚Äã with little or no exposure to ‚Å£the sun and ‚Äãits exclusive diet is, in many cases, breast milk which, being the‚Å£ best food for children, does not ‚Å£contain‚Äã large quantities‚Äç of vitamin D.
Vitamin D has several important functions, such as supporting bone health or the immune system, but ‚Äãdoes it also help‚Å¢ prevent disease? The ‚Å¢first activity described for vitamin D‚Äç at the ‚Å§end ‚Å¢of the 19th century, ‚Å£and therefore the best known, is the‚Äå action it‚Äç exerts on‚Äç the ‚Äãmusculoskeletal‚Äç system, ‚Å¢contributing ‚Å¢to the strengthening of bones and ‚Å¢muscles.‚Äç In recent years, the importance of vitamin D in the correct functioning of ‚Äçthe ‚Å¢immune system has‚Å¢ been‚Äã defined, helping ‚Å£to reduce the ‚Å§risk of respiratory‚Äã infections, autoimmune diseases and some‚Äã types of cancer.
What‚Äç other positive ‚Äåeffects does vitamin D have ‚Äãon the body?
More recentstudies‚Å§ also suggest that adequate levels of vitamin D help control‚Äå blood pressure and ‚Äçreduce inflammation. ‚Å¢Other studies suggest that vitamin D‚Äç improves insulin sensitivity,‚Äå which is very important in the ‚Å£development and evaluation of ‚Äçdiabetes.‚Å£ These results are very ‚Äãencouraging‚Å£ and‚Äã should encourage us to take care of our ‚Äãvitamin D levels, mainly through a‚Å¢ balanced ‚Å¢diet, regular ‚Å£outdoor exercise and a healthy lifestyle.
Many people don‚Äôt‚Äã get enough vitamin D through sun exposure and diet. So do supplements work?
It ‚Äçis true that there are segments of the population for‚Å£ which it is more‚Å£ difficult to maintain‚Å§ vitamin D ‚Å£levels: these are‚Äã the at-risk populations we ‚Å§talked about earlier. In these cases, it is advisable to consult the doctor to monitor the patient‚Äôs‚Äå vitamin ‚ÄçD levels ‚Å§and, according to his ‚Äåcriteria, ‚Å§recommend a treatment to‚Å£ restore, and then maintain, ‚Äåvitamin D‚Å¢ levels.
Among these‚Äã supplements we see that there is vitamin D2 and D3.‚Å§ How do they differ?
With both being a viable health option, vitamin D3 is usually‚Äç the‚Äã choice due‚Äç to its greater‚Å£ potency and effectiveness. These two forms differ in their origin: vitamin D3 (cholecalciferol) comes from foods ‚Å§of animal ‚Å£origin, while vitamin‚Å£ D2 (ergocalciferol) comes from plant ‚Äçsources. ‚Å£This is why‚Äå vegetarian or vegan patients‚Å§ usually prefer to‚Å§ be treated with vitamin D2 supplements.
And what is better: drops, pills or ampoules?
All presentations have the same dose. It is the doctor ‚Äãwho must recommend the dose and form‚Äã based‚Äã on the patient‚Äôs‚Å£ characteristics. ‚ÄãWhen it comes to administering vitamin D, there are ‚Å§more convenient dosage forms. For example, oral solutions in children, always equipped with a reliable and accurate dosing system. In adults, solid oral forms are convenient and ensure accurate dosing. Administration ‚Äãin‚Äå tablets minimizes the‚Äç risk ‚Äãof medication errors described for liquid forms.
Supplements for children too?
Vitamin D supplements can be very beneficial to the ‚Äãhealth‚Å¢ of children, especially those who do not‚Å£ get enough vitamin D through ‚Å¢diet and sun exposure. ‚ÄåHowever, ‚Å§it ‚Å¢is‚Å£ essential to consult a pediatrician before starting any supplementation.
want to receive the best content to‚Å¢ take care of‚Å¢ your‚Äã health and feel good?‚Å¢ Sign up for‚Å£ our new ‚Å§one for free news .
The passage discusses the importance of vitamin D,‚Å£ its sources, and the ‚Äåpopulations ‚Äåat risk for deficiency. Here are some ‚Å£key points‚Å£ summarized:
Lifestyle Factors : Many ‚Äåpeople have‚Äç sedentary lifestyles and ‚Äåspend considerable time‚Äã indoors, which limits their exposure to sunlight and can lead to hypovitaminosis D. This is particularly true in some‚Äå populations where vitamin D deficiency ‚Äårates are higher than in other‚Äç countries. At-Risk Populations : Certain groups are more ‚Äãsusceptible to vitamin D deficiency: -‚Å§ Those ‚Äãwho‚Äç have limited sun exposure (e.g., individuals‚Å§ who work ‚Å§indoors, night‚Å§ shift workers).
‚Å§ ‚Äì The elderly, whose skin becomes‚Äç less efficient‚Å¢ at producing vitamin D as they age.
‚Å§ ‚Äì Individuals living in long-term care facilities, who often have restricted mobility.
‚Å¢ ‚Äì Obese individuals,‚Å¢ as vitamin D can get trapped in fat cells.
‚Äç -‚Äã Patients ‚Äãwith chronic diseases or those taking medications (like corticosteroids) that affect vitamin D metabolism.
Children‚Äôs Needs : ‚Äì Children over one year‚Äç require about 600 IU of vitamin D per day, which can be obtained through moderate sun exposure and a diet rich in vitamin D.
‚Äì Infants under one ‚Å¢year are at risk‚Äç as breast milk may not‚Å§ provide ‚Å¢sufficient vitamin D.
Functions of Vitamin D : ‚Å£ ‚Äì Supports bone health and muscle strength.
‚Äì Plays a role in the immune system and may help reduce the ‚Äçrisk of ‚Å¢respiratory infections, autoimmune diseases,‚Å§ and certain cancers.
-‚Äç Recent studies indicate it may influence‚Äã blood pressure ‚Å§regulation and improve insulin sensitivity.
Supplementation : For those who struggle to maintain adequate vitamin ‚ÄåD levels through‚Å£ sunlight and diet, supplements‚Å¢ may be recommended, especially for at-risk populations.‚Äã It‚Äôs‚Å£ important to consult a healthcare‚Å§ provider for‚Äã monitoring ‚Äãand recommendations. Types of Vitamin D : ‚Äç ‚Å£- Vitamin D3 (cholecalciferol) is preferred due to ‚Å£its potency and effectiveness; it is derived from animal sources.
‚Äå ‚Å£ ‚Äì Vitamin D2 (ergocalciferol) comes from plant sources and may be preferred by‚Å§ vegetarians or vegans.
These insights highlight the significance of ‚Äçmaintaining adequate vitamin D‚Äã levels‚Äç for overall health and the need for increased awareness and proactive‚Å¢ measures,‚Äç especially among vulnerable populations.

author: VNExplorer
title: Here are 8 Japanese PC games you should be looking forward to in 2024
text:
Here are 8 Japanese PC games you should be looking forward to in 2024
Wow, what a year 2023 was. We had a runaway success in dice rolling, catchy musical numbers in horror games, and‚Äîpraise the sun‚Äîa brand new Armored Core to play. Beyond Armored Core, Japanese games had a strong year on PC, from Resident Evil 4 early in the year to the latest Like a Dragon near its end.
But that eventful time is swiftly transforming into a fading memory. Last year‚Äôs shiniest games have been all played out, backlogs have been diligently cleared (or completely ignored), and plenty of room has hopefully been made on spacious SSDs, ready to embrace all the storage-hungry big hits that are heading our way. And that‚Äôs great‚Äîit‚Äôs time to limber up for Tekken 8, slap on some winter sunscreen before Like A Dragon: Infinite Wealth flies in, and catch up with Final Fantasy 14 in time for Dawntrail. But beyond these incoming headline acts there are plenty of other Japanese games worth putting on our wishlists‚Äîincluding these eight underdogs.
Dragon‚Äôs Dogma 2 Developer: CAPCOM Co., Ltd. | Release date: 22 Mar, 2024
I know this feels like an obvious choice‚Äîsurely nobody‚Äôs going to skip a new Capcom game‚Äîbut it‚Äôs worth remembering that there‚Äôs a reason why it‚Äôs taken so long for a Dragon‚Äôs Dogma sequel to show up, and it‚Äôs got little to do with the time director Hideaki Itsuno spent dragging Devil May Cry‚Äôs reputation out of the mud. To be blunt: as good as it was, nobody bought the incredible fantasy RPG that thought nothing of mixing potential shopkeeper romances with hardcore speedrunning modes and epic fights against gigantic climbable bosses. According to Capcom‚Äôs own sales reports, Dragon‚Äôs Dogma: Dark Arisen was outsold by two different SNES ports of Street Fighter 2 and a PSP Monster Hunter game that never left Japan, even though it was easily one of the best games of its generation.
All signs point to this sequel being just as much of a masterwork, so Capcom can‚Äôt go wrong‚Äîunless nobody buys it, again.
Eiyuden Chronicle: Hundred Heroes Developer: Rabbit and Bear Studios | Release date: 23 Apr, 2024
The well loved yet rarely affordable RPG series Suikoden‚Äôs back‚Äîonly this time it‚Äôs not by Konami, or called Suikoden. But in spite of all the obvious changes, much in Eiyuden Chronicle: Hundred Heroes is going to look instantly familiar to anyone fond of the good old PS1 RPG days of vampires, squirrel squads, minigames, and fascinating regional power struggles.
Whether it really can rebottle PlayStation-era lightning remains to be seen, but between Eiyuden Chronicle: Rising‚Äôs positive reception, the inclusion of several of the ‚Äô90s classic‚Äôs key staff members, and the impressive screenshots shown on the Hundred Heroes‚Äôs website, it looks like it‚Äôs in with a good chance.
Penny Blood: Hellbound Developer: NatsumeAtari, STUDIO WILDROSE | Release date: Q3 2024
Every crowdfunded indie project these days has to offer its backers an even more indie spinoff game to idle away the long months/years between handing over their money and the final release of whatever they were hoping to play, and this one belongs to Penny Blood, a game that will eventually be a spiritual sequel to cult classic PlayStation 2 RPG series Shadow Hearts. Hellbound promises to be an intense action-roguelike with added, um, bloodsurfing, apparently, delivered via an eye-catching art style that mixes the cute with the macabre. It should be an intriguing teaser before the main event, and both of these games can‚Äôt come soon enough for my liking.
R-Type Tactics I ‚Ä¢ II Cosmos Developer: Granzella Inc. | Release date: ??? [Steam page still says 2023]
Common sense tells us that R-Type, the classic arcade shmup, shouldn‚Äôt work when reimagined as a turn based strategy game, yet Cosmos easily proves that the series its in its element when its interplanetary shootouts are stuffed with stats and take place on busy hex grids.
This extensive graphical overhaul of the brilliant PSP originals (the latter of which was previously never released outside Japan) was due out last summer, only to be sadly delayed. It doesn‚Äôt matter too much. Even if they‚Äôre ‚Äúonly‚Äù as good as they used to be when we do finally get to play them on our PCs, the quietly unsettling Cosmos will still instantly become one of the best tactical games of 2024.
The Legend of Heroes: Trails Through Daybreak Developer: Nihon Falcom, PH3 GmbH | Release date: Summer 2024 [Steam page lists initial non-English release date]
As the 11th game in a series that began years ago with Trails in the Sky, it‚Äôd be easy to assume there‚Äôs an air of ‚ÄúBeen there, done that‚Äù hanging over Trails Through Daybreak, that anyone who cares already knows exactly who‚Äôs in it and how it‚Äôs going to play.
That assumption would be wrong. Daybreak is the beginning of another fresh story within an ongoing saga, bringing with it new faces, places, and all sorts of ways to hit all sorts of enemies really, really, hard. It‚Äôs due out in English this summer‚Äîthat might be enough time to catch up on the others, if you‚Äôre quick.
Under Night In-Birth II Sys:Celes Developer: FRENCH-BREAD, Arc System Works | Release date: 24 Jan, 2024
‚ÄúSys:Celes sinks towards ruination.
For the Immortalize, the collapse of all that is, looms on the horizon.
The curtain rises on the final chapter of the Hollow Night. Catastrophe beckons‚Ä¶‚Äù
I may not understand Under Night‚Äôs plot, but I do know that this 2D fighter is going to be pretty, it‚Äôs going to be intense, and within 10 seconds of online play I‚Äôm sure it‚Äôs going to make me feel like I should never challenge another human being to a virtual fight again. However much I lose, with 24 characters to choose from and rollback netcode, I‚Äôm sure this is going to be a lot of fun.
Blade Chimera Developer: Team Ladybug, WSS playground | Release date: 2024
There‚Äôs no escaping indie Metroidvanias, although this one manages to stand out from the crowd thanks to luscious pixel art, an unusual sci-fi ‚Äòn‚Äô sorcery theme, and its developers short but impressive track record. Blade Chimera‚Äôs the latest game from Team Ladybug, who previously worked on Record of Lodoss War-Deedlit in Wonder Labyrinth- and Touhou Luna Nights. Both of their previous games took the Symphony of the Night-like genre in interesting new directions, so I‚Äôd be surprised if this didn‚Äôt continue that welcome trend.
‚àÄstralbringer -Shaded Arkarium- Developer: Endless Shirafu | Release date: February 2024
This one just launched on January 2, but only in Japanese‚ÄîEnglish support is expected to arrive in February or March. A quick dip into the almost untypeable ‚àÄstralbringer‚Äôs playable demo throws more bullets on screen at once than some shmups do in entire runs, and the default KB+M control method doesn‚Äôt exactly help with survival. This isn‚Äôt in any danger of being the most welcoming shmup to casually try out‚Äîthe demo‚Äôs lengthy Japanese language tutorial is required reading, and the weapon/shield systems take some getting used to‚Äîbut it‚Äôs definitely a memorable one, and it feels like something of a breath of fresh air in one of gaming‚Äôs oldest genres.
